title: The Fiora rework looks potentially incredible
body: There's an absolute ton of stuff going on in it so it's really hard to tell what it'll be like without actually taking it for a test drive but... so far I'm thinking well done. So much chase potential, so much more utility than before and yet she looks so much better to play against.

I definitely share this worry, to some degree. [I believe] we tuned the block duration to be long enough so that Fiora doesn't always need to twitch-block, but can often use the ability in advance, predicting her opponent's move. We really wanted to create some cerebral play as well as some mechanical play.

In fact, in many cases cerebral play is required. For example, when Warwick is coming to gank Fiora, Fiora can't re-actively block his R, but she can try to mind game him by casting the block right before she expects him to ult. It gets even deeper in other scenarios, such as when Jax is using his E -- the Jax needs to guess when Fiora's going to block, and Fiora needs to predict when Jax is going to stun.

Lastly, many champion's key CCs have telegraphs, which should curb this 'super-twitch-reactive' element. Blocking Cho Gath's Q for example, is much less stressful than blocking Irelia's E. The hope is that these various uses will allow most Fiora players to succeed with 'Riposte' even without incredible reflexes. We'll see how that pans out!

Is it just me or does her Ultimate seem a little out of place and underwhelming? Now I am not saying I think it is terrible, but part of it doesn't even feel like it fits her theme. I like her new passive, but adding it as part of her Ultimate seems a bit lazy. And adding an area heal is nice, but how does that make sense for her character design. For a champion that is suppose to be flashy and a true artist with a blade her Ultimate just seems very dull to me.

It's a bit out of the box from what most melee dps champs would bring, true. The goal is that we also want every champ to bring something unique and significant to their team outside of their base line role.

To explain, when we asked the question "when compared to master yi, what does fiora bring different to the team?" We were looking for something outside of just pure dps that she could offer. The theme is that when she can successfully 'duel' that target the team gets a pretty strong, almost "fight reset," level heal.

I really like the direction the Riot seems to be going with the reworks and new champions and making sure the they are all unique but can still have a meaningful role. The Question I have is how does her ultimate thematically provide an area heal?  Again, I am not looking at it as a bad thing, or something that she shouldn't be able to provide her team. I am mainly looking at if from the standpoint of does it fit her theme, and could there be any other abilities that might have looked more appropriate on her that would also help out her team?

Perhaps I am getting alittle too far into it, I just like to know why different champions have certain abilities. 

For example:
{{champion:201}} has a shield and can block projectiles. Makes sense.
{{champion:421}} is a burrower and can create tunnels. Makes sense.
{{champion:114}} is a duelist and can heal her teammates. But Why?
They are so in awe of how she just rekt her opponent that their wounds decide it's not worth existing any more.

The theme is that when she can successfully 'duel' that target the team gets a pretty strong, almost "fight reset," level heal.

Do you think a strong, almost "fight reset," level heal is the unique thing a champion like Fiora should bring to the team, though? Thematically, it makes no sense--not as a competitive fighter, not as a duelist or fencer. 

I like that it interacts with her new very position-based gameplay, but do you think a big healing area is how she should be rewarded with striking all of an enemy's vitals? Perhaps a disarming effect, or pretty much anything else that would come out of a fencer like Fiora without making you double-take and wonder why the Grand Duelist just sewed up all her team's wounds.

It actually fits quite well with the rest of the ult, I'll explain. In testing we tried a BUNCH of different reward types (damage buffs, speed, cooldowns etc) for her winning the duel, and we found that there were a few reasons why this one stuck as the most useful and fitting. 

-By the time she gets to that hard earned 4th proc, she is usually desperately in need of some heals (being a squishy melee carry)
-The "fight reset" elements of it give her this great "one down, who's next?" feeling 
-Too much immediate reward makes her into a snowball champ like katarina, so the reward is given over time instead of burst
-The team benefits from it so that when fiora calls out her challenge, everyone cares about her success. They might help by CCing the target or keeping her alive so she can win

I hope that helps explain some of the reasoning for how we ended up with this current victory reward. Play it and see if it feels right to you too.

Oh, no, trust me, I understand the mechanical reasoning behind it perfectly well. From a pure gameplay and mechanics standpoint, you guys approached each of these problems fairly reasonably (team-wide benefits keep her from being too "selfish" a champ, having a heal rather than something that directly kills people makes her less snowball-y and gives her some fallback, squishy melee characters usually like heals unless they're Yasuo and can kill everyone before they need any, etc.). It's just that there's more to the puzzle than that--it's like finishing one side of a Rubic's cube just to turn it over and find that all the other sides are still scrambled.  

In a lot of the work I do, whether it's redesigns or any of my [more original work](http://rfmelley.wix.com/portfolio#!original/cghg), I am constantly tasked with filling in holes and guiding gameplay in ways that are both healthy and natural--natural being one of the key words, here. When any kit is under the microscope, I always find it best to establish a clear, niche goal for that character (which is mostly informed by theme and appearance) and build everything around that. With Fiora, here, we have a duelist--someone who specializes in one-on-one fights, to the point where her father assisting in one of her duels is a great point of personal shame for her--and yet her defining contribution to her team greatly favors huge, crowded teamfights.

And in general, I think one of the greatest downfalls behind this kit was the mindset behind approaching her as a champion that will be playable in League matches--**it's working under the assumption that all games can and should be defined by big clustered-up teamfights**, that every champion should have a big tool that throws something new into one of those crazy messes, that exploring other strategies through champion kit design might rock the boat or result in a dud. 

However, if there's anything I've learned from playing a good few hundred games of Heroes of the Storm, it's that even in a much faster-paced and more co-operation driven game, not everything boils down to throwing two teams at each other. You've got heroes like Abathur who prefer breaking the enemy team up (since he adds 0.5 to individual ally heroes rather than being a present 1 himself, and constant 1.5 vs 1s are better than 4.5 vs 5s), or those like Zagara and Gazlowe who are generally lackluster in teamfights but can apply amazing map pressure and contribute to their team through objectives. In Fiora's case, this could be equated to being that one hero you pick because someone on the enemy team is going to constantly solo objectives while their team stalls and you need someone to poke a few holes in them, or when you need someone who can break the enemy team up because she can pressure their toplane while everyone else is fighting over jungle objectives, and the enemy team knows they'll have to send two because duels are what Fiora's made for. **In other words, players should want to pick Fiora because they want a Grand Duelist, not a walking health pack. **

On many other characters and archetypes, this would've made perfect sense and exist as a great and flavorful addition to their kit. Aatrox just took that guy down? "Let's all get back in the fight! I think we can turn this battle around!" Warwick just went to town on some juicy carry? "Alpha wolf just secured our prey, let us feast!" Having Fiora be this big teamfighting powerhouse is like being in a fencing/boxing/MMA match and having all your mates flood the stage because you got in a really nice blow and then helping you take down your next four opponents. Not the coolest thing you could have on a duelist! It helps a lot if you think of it cinematically--think about any cool fencing duel you've seen in a show or movie (Princess Bride almost immediately comes to mind), and then try to imagine how those effects would be represented, and if they'd make that scene better or worse. Would Inigo's final fight be cooler if Fezzik came in and bashed the other guy on the head? Probably not!

Also, out of curiosity, do you know exactly the thought process behind the E? It's not too out-of-the blue, but it does seem a little bland, and during testing, I didn't really see much use for it beyond "it does damage" (which a lot of things do) and having the small slow sort of help position for weak point poking.

Because her old ultimate was extremely frustrating to play against. Champion abilities should feel good to play against just as much as they feel good to use, that's why we all hate Kalista. Fiora being able to deal a crapton of damage to you, heck even towerdive you with a click of a button where the enemy can't do anything against her at all...no way that's fun to play against.

Also, it was a point and click ability that I feel doesn't fit to Fiora's identity as a masterful dualist, when playing her you should feel like a dancing fencer as well, something as simple to use as that point and click extremely powerful ult doesn't fit IMO.

Just to clarify, I am fine with them changing her current Ult and I understand the reasons for doing so. I guess I just really want champions to have a solid kit that fits them perfectly from a thematic standpoint. In this situation, I understand what they are doing with her ult, and I really like the other changes to her kit, but I am simply not impressed with the look and feel of her new ultimate.
And it doesn't fit the identity of a dualist.  If it empowered you then it might have worked, but Fiora is not a Support which is what this feels like.
